definition: younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: The acting skill of the player is not a quarter as good as his professional brothers.
sentences.chinese: 那位演員的演技遠遠不如他的師兄弟們。

sentences.english: A few division brother that bully Zhang Moji at ordinary times are bullying him again.
sentences.chinese: 幾個平時欺負張無忌的師兄弟又在欺負他。

sentences.english: To his astonishment he found his Master and the other disciples sitting there, absorbed in meditation.
sentences.chinese: 他驚訝地發現他的導師和師兄弟都坐在那裏冥想。

definition: venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to learn a skill or art
sect/school (group of followers of a particular doctrine)
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
